programme.title: UFC 305: Du Plessis vs. Adesanya - Prelims
programme.desc: Jack Jenkins vs. Herbert Burns, featherweight; Casey O'Neill vs. Luana Santos, flyweight; Josh Culibao vs. Ricardo Ramos, featherweight; Junior Tafa vs. Valter Walker, heavyweight. From RAC Arena in Perth, Australia.

programme.title: Boxing
programme.desc: Christian Mbilli (27-0, 23 KOs) faces Sergiy Derevyanchenko (15-5, 10 KOs) in a super middleweight bout, 10 rounds. From Centre Videotron in Quebec City.

programme.title: SportsCenter
programme.desc: The latest news, highlights and inside information from every corner of the sports world is presented each day on "SportsCenter," ESPN's first-ever program when the network debuted in September of 1979. The flagship series airs an evening edition and a brand new midnight show each weekday before the stage is cleared for a live "SportsCenter" morning block that emphasizes fast-paced, highlights-driven reports and what's new on social media platforms.

programme.title: E60
programme.desc: ESPN's morning sports magazine show, featuring the biggest names and stories in sports.

programme.title: E60
programme.desc: Exploring one of the rarest feats in all of sports: the perfect game. With in-depth interviews with 15 pitchers in this unique MLB fraternity we dive into the drama and psychology of achieving baseball perfection.

programme.title: Baseball Tonight: Sunday Night Countdown
programme.desc: Leading into each of ESPN's Sunday Night Baseball telecasts is this special edition of "Baseball Tonight." Host Karl Ravech teams with analysts and reporters to present fans a detailed preview of the network's exclusive, national game of the week. Highlights of the day's other games, interviews with players and managers, and key storylines from around the league also fill the hourlong show. Mark Teixeira, Eduardo Pérez, Tim Kurkjian and Buster Olney are among the analysts.

programme.title: MLB Baseball
programme.desc: Tarik Skubal seeks his MLB-leading 15th win as his Tigers end a set with the Yankees. Skubal (14-4, 2.53 ERA) struck out 12 Yankees in his May 5 start, but took a no-decision. Aaron Judge (NYY) hit one of his first 300 homers off Skubal in that game.

programme.desc: The latest news, highlights and inside information from every corner of the sports world is presented each day on "SportsCenter," ESPN's first-ever program when the network debuted in September of 1979. programme.title: Get Up
programme.desc: ESPN's morning show features host Mike Greenberg with a rotating and diverse group of analysts opining about and analyzing the latest news from the world of sports. The two-hour, personality-driven show originates from Manhattan's South Street Seaport, a locale that attracts high-profile guests. Greenberg, aka "Greeny," is formerly one-half of ESPN Radio's longtime "Mike & Mike" morning show.

programme.title: First Take
programme.desc: Stephen A. Smith joins host Molly Qerim on this weekday morning sports debate show. Smith provides his expert takes on the day's trending sports topics and under-the-radar news. They're regularly joined by veteran analysts and the top guests in sports and entertainment.

programme.title: The Pat McAfee Show
programme.desc: Former NFL punter Pat McAfee brings his humor and candor to the microphone to highlight the day's top stories.

programme.title: Fantasy Football Now
programme.desc: "Fantasy Football Now" airs live on Sunday mornings during the NFL season, a time when fans are making last-minute roster moves and need the latest news from around the league. Providing the latest info are host Field Yates, analysts Mike Clay and Damien Woody, and senior writer and injury analyst Stephania Bell. Also contributing to the show are ESPN's NFL reporters, who bring fantasy players the latest intel from game sites and, in many cases, straight from the coach's mouth to give fantasy owners everything they need to know to set their lineups.

programme.title: Yankees-Dodgers: An Uncivil War
programme.desc: In 1977 and 1978, the New York Yankees and Los Angeles Dodgers squared off in back-to-back World Series. This ESPN Films documentary tells the story of a rivalry filled with colorful characters, seismic controversies and unforgettable moments.

programme.title: 30 for 30
programme.desc: The story of Michael Chang's improbable rise as a young American tennis star, and his family's immigrant journey which shaped his destiny. The story is centered around his winning the 1989 French Open at age 17.

programme.title: 30 for 30
programme.desc: The rise and fall of FaZe Clan, the first professional esports team to make it big.

programme.title: Shirley
programme.desc: Shirley is the real story of the inimitable Shirley Muldowney. Salty, sassy, unflappable - Shirley crushed stereotypes and became an integral part of the gritty, golden age of drag racing. Her aggressive approach fueled intense rivalries, passionate fan reactions, and sometimes caustic headlines but never derailed her quest to be a champion.
